action: I want to process application tasks (expenses, purchasing, leave, etc.) following internal approval flow rules
reason: To prevent fraudulent applications and missed approvals, and to maintain internal control
acceptance_criteria: Application creation is only possible for authenticated users.
The application type (expenses, purchasing, leave, etc.) is mandatory.
An approval flow definition exists for each application type.
Approval flow settings can only be changed by administrators.
Approval steps can be configured in multiple stages.
An approval role is linked to each step.
Approvers are automatically determined based on roles.
If an approver is absent, tasks are automatically assigned to a proxy approver.
Mandatory item checks are performed when saving application data.
Numerical validation is applied to monetary items.
Attachments are stored only after passing a virus scan.
Attachments are stored in encrypted storage.
Application IDs are automatically numbered and unique.
Application status is restricted to Draft / Pending / Approved / Rejected.
Updates to invalid status values will fail.
Controls are in place to prevent proceeding to the next step before approval.
Approval operations are only possible for authorized users.
Electronic signature logs are recorded during approval.
Comments can be entered for each approval/rejection operation.
Reason input is mandatory for rejections.
Approval and rejection operations are recorded in the audit log.
Audit logs include user_id, action, timestamp, and IP address.
Application content updates are only possible in the Draft state.
Editing is prohibited once in the Pending state or later.
Changes to the approval flow during the process are saved as history.
Concurrent updates trigger conflict detection via optimistic locking.
The same validation applies to operations via API.
Parameterized queries are used as SQL injection countermeasures.
Input values are sanitized (Anti-XSS).
CSRF countermeasures are enabled.
Communication is mandatory via HTTPS.
A notification event is issued upon approval completion.
Notifications are sent via an asynchronous queue.
Application history is searchable.
Searches can be filtered by application type, date, and status.
There is timeout monitoring to detect delayed approval cases.
Alert notifications are issued when SLA is exceeded.
Internal DB structures are not included in the response.
The API is REST-compliant.
API versioning is managed.
Audit logs are stored in tamper-evident storage.
Log retention periods are manageable.
The target processing response time is within 500ms.
